The Central Bureau of Investigation has registered a case against the Managing Director of a Chennai-based company for allegedly defaulting on a Rs.124 crore loan following a complaint from the Central Bank of India.

CBI sources said the case was registered against K. Srinivas Kalyan Rao, who is the Managing Director of Chennai-based Best and Crompton Engineering Projects Ltd, under IPC sections related to criminal conspiracy, cheating and forgery, among others. It has been alleged that the company had borrowed Rs 304 crore from a consortium of banks comprising Central Bank of India, Andhra Bank and Corporation Bank by way of fund-based and non-fund-based limits. — PTI

Searches conducted

S. Vijay Kumar reports from Chennai:

The CBI reportedly conducted simultaneous searches on the house and company of Mr. Srinivas Kalyan Rao, son of a former CBI Director, in Hyderabad and Chennai on Saturday in connection with the multicrore bank fraud case. During scrutiny it was found that the accused had allegedly furnished forged documents in support of the purchases. The account was declared a non-performing asset.

Chennai-based accused had allegedly furnished forged documents for purchases
title: CBI case against businessman
